moscow-- former soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev said thursday that the overwhelming election of Barack Obama shows that americans want change, and he called on the incoming Barack Obama to extend his promised changes to u.s. relations with russia and iran. the entire world felt that america wanted change and was expecting change, Mikhail Gorbachev , 77, said in an interview with the associated press. he noted that some in russia have called Barack Obama the american Mikhail Gorbachev because of his promises to bring change to his country.
